intro: Hieracium incisum subsp. neilreichii, commonly known as the Neilreich's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has finely divided, serrated leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. This subspecies is often found in alpine and subalpine zones, where it thrives in cooler, moist conditions.
